Reviews.Title: nice tablet
Reviews.Author: joecool
Reviews.Content: bought to upgrade my blackberry playbook, and a nice upgrade. more features, good battery life, and not too much bigger. overall happy with the unit with the only concern being the screen. I have had many other tablets, low end and higher end, including the Lenovo thinkpad tablet 2, and the acer screen is a little funny. seems a tad glossy in a weird way, I think its just a cheaper screen than my Lenovo?? so be weary, some cant stand it, others don't notice. other than that, good product so far. had to get the keyboard for upper level college!!!!!

Reviews.Title: For students or working away from the office, it's a nice choice
Reviews.Author: Terry "tcinsatx@yahoodotcom"
Reviews.Content: This Acer Iconia W-3 is a rockin' little tablet with some excellent features IF you make sure it suits your needs.My opinion is that Windows 8 tablets (including the Surface and Surface Pro) are the closest thing to a laptop replacement you can get in a tablet. They shine at work, educational and email activities, but will disappoint when it comes to gaming due to the paltry number of gaming apps available. However, if your desire is a more portable alternative to your laptop for work, school or travel, I think this is a fine tablet to consider.The Iconia has an 8.1" screen with a display that is mediocre. It's great staring straight at it, but at any other angle, it suffers, so this wouldn't be a good choice if you plan on watching movies or videos with another person. This isn't really a problem for me since I think an 8" screen isn't well suited for more than one person viewing anyway. It's backlit and has good resolution and for working or inputting data or watching videos solo, it's just fine for me.It has a micro-SD card slot, a micro-USB port (2.0), a micro-HDMI port, and front and rear facing cameras (both 2MP) so it's nicely appointed. No cables included, though, so I suggest getting a micro to regular USB adapter cable and a micro to regular HDMI adapter cable.The wireless capabilities are somewhat lacking, IMO, because the range is the least strong of any tablet I have in my home. I can't get a reliable signal upstairs at the other end of my house from my router, but I do have a very large house. However, I can with a Surface and with an iPad. Keep this in mind if you need to use a tablet in an area that is far from your router.Battery life has been very good. I get the full 8 hours advertised on a single charge. It comes with one of those pin-type charger instead of a mini USB type charger. That's mildly disappointing because I have to remember to bring this particular charger with me when I travel.The build looks a little cheesy, although it feels solid and well built. The front has a white plastic frame and then the back has a silver plastic frame. Later, after I ordered the Acer bluetooth keyboard that is designed to go with this tablet, it made more sense. The tablet snaps into the back of the silver keyboard, face down, for storage and easy portability so the silver back makes it look seamless. Still doesn't explain the white frame around the front but that's just aesthetics.This Iconia is a true Windows 8 tablet - not Windows RT. If you've never used Windows 8, there will definitely be a learning curve. Once I got used to it, Windows 8 is actually pretty quick to get around in and I'm liking it but be warned, it's a big change from Win 7 or earlier.The fact that the Iconia comes with a fully licensed Microsoft Office Home and Student version is the thing that makes this tablet very, very attractive, IMO. If you currently use Office, you know how expensive this software is to purchase.To get the most out of a Win 8 tablet, I strongly recommend getting a keyboard (bluetooth) and mouse. To my mind, using powerful apps like Office without a keyboard and mouse is an unnecessary waste of time. Productivity is this tablet's strong suit so get a keyboard. I personally like a mouse so I use the tiny Microsoft Wedge Touch bluetooth mouse and it works well, but it's a little pricey. You can easily use an inexpensive USB mouse if you buy a micro to regular USB adapter for a few bucks.I did purchase the Acer keyboard designed to go with this tablet, but I don't especially recommend it because it seems to run through batteries. Otherwise, it's nice, well-built, has an integrated stand for the tablet and a storage slot in the back for your tablet. However, I also have a bluetooth Logitech keyboard with a case that converts to a tablet stand and it works just fine at half the price. (You'll need some kind of stand for your tablet no matter what.)There are very few covers available for the Iconia and of those, not all of them fit properly. I purchased this cover and it fits and functions well at a great price. VSTN Iconia W3 810 Multi Angle Slim FITAt this writing, since this 32GB Iconia is just under $280 AND includes Office, I think students and anyone wanting a highly portable work environment will find it worth putting on the short list.

Reviews.Title: With new price drop, definitely worth a go
Reviews.Author: C. Lofton
Reviews.Content: I'd been eyeing up this unit for the last month and finally popped for it last week - if only I'd waited a few more days...I could've saved myself $30.  But you know what - absolutely no regrets:  I love this thing and for $299, I think it's more than worth a shot.  I can't believe the "refreshed" model will come in anywhere near this price point and is a "better" screen really worth the extra $100+?Don't get me wrong, the complaints about the screen are valid but you do get used to it.  I'm a Windows gal so having a full W8 OS (my first encounter with it) in a unit so small and portable has been great.  Not too bothered about some of the Windows Store apps but having MS Office preloaded and being able to run Vulkano Player (meaning I can access my DirecTV box from anywhere I go; perfect when connected via HDMI to a flatscreen TV in your hotel when travelling), and my music training software like EarMaster and GuitarPro on it has made it more than worth the price to me.If the refreshed version comes in at a reasonable price point, I may very well snap one up as a better screen would certainly be welcome for these middle-aged eyes.  But poor screen or no, I've got to say a backup unit of this current version for the heck of it is mighty tempting - especially if the price drops any further.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: lance66 "lance domhoff"
Reviews.Content: I cant get over how many people DON'T know what they are buying then put it down because they bought it. This is well worth the price and is very well made. I've had mine since launch and I love mine. I have the Acer case and keyboard dock. I just hate when people get miss informed and then get upset. I knew what this was going to be and I love it. It is powerful and screen is good, not the best but very usable. If you have never used a product with an Atom processor you will think it is a tad slow but its on par with most of the tablets iv'e owned. (Galaxy Tab 2,Kindle Fire or the Nook.) Keyboard dock is wonderful and very useful. I like that you can throw this in any bag or backpack and do what you have to do for the day. Can't express enough about this Acer product is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet except for limited screen view angles
Reviews.Author: J. Tankersley
Reviews.Content: Love the tablet (except the screens limited view angles - but not a deal breaker for me).Full Windows 8 on an 8.1 inch tablet, very responsive performance, micro SDXC (64GB), micro USB, all day battery life and free Microsoft Office (just Activate it with the included Authorization Code)... Nice!(Review written on this tablet with an Acer bluetooth keyboard and Börnd bluetooth mouse).

Reviews.Title: Not Your Average Tablet
Reviews.Author: Weatherman
Reviews.Content: After having this for almost 30 days now, I'm still learning it.  I've used Droid, Kindle Fire and Apple based tablets, but  this one is Microsoft and really different than the other two.  Really different than the othersWhat I'm still trying to find (if anyone knows, let me know) is the tablet ships in a auto screen lock mode (when log in you always need the password).  HOW do I turn this off so I do not need to use my password each time I turn it on and log in?  Anyone reply to me with an answer?  I cannot find this anywhere.Out of the box it connected to my WiFi with no problems.It surfs the Net good.It's just like having Windows 8 in the palm of your hand!I don't have a problem with the brightness of the screen.  It is bright, but not enough to cause me any problems.The camera has not given me any problems.Other than learning how to disable the auto lock.  I'm happy with this tablet.UPDATE 8/28/2013:I needed to wipe my tablet and start as if it were out of the box....According to Acer website, Acer does not have a telephone contact. Your options are email or Live Chat.I waited less than a minute to chat with someone.I found if you need to wipe your tablet, there is no way to do it unless you have an External USB DVD/CD Drive.There is a pin/push button (slim pin) near the micro card slot.  However this is only to reset the battery.  It will not reset or wipe the device.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: G. Leahy "gerardpl"
Reviews.Content: $350. For a 64 gig little tablet is great. Screen not perfect but good enough  head to head with my iPad mink and its about the same. I went head to head with the same music video and I could see pimples on the singers face that can't be see on the mini.I can play on my chess site and am learning Spanish on it. So it fits my needs

Reviews.Title: Great tablet! windows based includes office but make sure to upgrade to windows 8.1 for free.
Reviews.Author: West1582
Reviews.Content: Great little tablet with full windows 8 installed. For the price for a windows tablet which runs the full version and to include office its's a great deal. Great size snappy function and feedback, mini hdmi to connect to bigger screen is a cool feature and also has a slot for a memory card. Resolution could be a little better but I'm mostly using this for work and school. Can't go wrong not sure about other negative reviews. I have bought two of these with no problems.

Reviews.Title: Well-worth the price I paid
Reviews.Author: D. Dunk "DiTeach"
Reviews.Content: OK, I've had this tablet since early September, and after reading so many negative reviews, I felt I just HAD to put my 2 cents worth in.  I bought it when it was on sale for $299.99, and a few weeks later I was also able to purchase the Bluetooth physical keyboard that goes with it for $25.00.  Together, they totally meet my needs for a Windows-based tablet that comes with Office installed.  For me, the screen resolution is just fine--I have a Kindle HD if I want to watch movies.  I mainly use it for word-processing, checking e-mail and Facebook, and it meets my needs just fine, at a price that I found extremely reasonable.

Reviews.Title: Can't go wrong for the price
Reviews.Author: Thomas f calabro jr
Reviews.Content: I gave this a 5 Star rating one because at $299.00 for a 64 GB windows 8 tablet ( NOT windows 8 RT)its loaded with the full vers: of windows 8. Which has been upgraded to windows 8.1 now with out any problems. and free MS Office Home and student, Thats a $139.00 Freebe that why it is a great price.I have read people conplaining about the screen ???  I know i don't look at this from the side, it's a 8.1" tablet !! For price you can't beat it. I have no problem watching movies on it or doing other work on it.  NO it's not a laptop or a Desktop but if you want to take your work with you you can!!,  I don't know why Acer states it takes a 32 Micro SD card ???  I run a 64 gb Micro SD card with no Problems so i have 128 GBs of space total. I bought two of these one for me and one for my son.their great.!!! PS charge this over night for a full 16 hours when you first get it, don,t go by the battery bar on display.

Reviews.Title: Great small tablet that runs regular Win 8.
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Lee
Reviews.Content: Since it uses the Intel Atom cpu inside, it has the capabilities of the regular Windows 8 laptop.  If you are not doing high intensive graphics, this is the tablet to get.I use this to keep track of my business.  I am able to install regular printer drivers to print wirelessly.

Reviews.Title: Iconia computer
Reviews.Author: Fred Rivas
Reviews.Content: Love the Iconia use it on a daily basis.  Carry it with me all the time. Except for the adapter problem I am very happy I purchased it

Reviews.Title: I'd give it 5 star if I can fix the bluetooth connection problem
Reviews.Author: Debra  White
Reviews.Content: I had to send it to Texas Because The Battery Needed Replacing But Customer Service Was Wonderful It Was Fully Paid For Then I Had Another Issue When I Downloaded Window 8.1 included with the tablet I had a driver issue I contacted customer service again and they helped me fix this problem The text on apps weren't displaying just blacked out lines I'm having Two  more issues to work out My bluetooth device is not connecting to my mobilie keyboard and my wireless printer needs the USB to work this might be my fault I might Of installed it wrongMake Sure you get the USB Connector When You Order The Acer Iconia You Will Need it

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: This little power house is more than I expected and well  worth what paid for it feel awkward at first but once  set it up you are good go. vcccdog

Reviews.Title: Great deal at $299
Reviews.Author: Lloyd123
Reviews.Content: The upside of all those negative reviews is that Acer is clearing out the old stock to make way for the new W4 - which will sell for close to $500 - so the W3 is a great bargain.Could the screen be better? Sure but it's not really that bad - more than adequate in normal room light - just don't try it in bright sunlight but that's also the case for even the iPad.It's fast and versatile. I was able to load an old version of PhotoShop 7.01 and the software for my old Sony LocationFree box so I can stream my cable box to the W3 anywhere in the world with a Wi-Fi connection.

Reviews.Title: Very Good!
Reviews.Author: Denaye Semego
Reviews.Content: Recieved Acer before the date given.  The product was bran new and worked great.  Set up was easy.  The only thing I had trouble with was getting used to windows 8.  Tablet froze on me a few times when i was in the app store but a reboot or waiting a few minutes it did fix itself but what do you except this is a tablet not a bran new high speed computer.  But i really do love the tablet.  Works great and is very portable and light. They are micro ports which i did not read carfully enough incase you are looking for a keyboard or anything to go along with it!

Reviews.Title: Very good overall. Don't hesitate. This is perfect.
Reviews.Author: Anthony B.
Reviews.Content: Ok, i got the Acer W3. I was worried thinking that it would not be that great, and not really a PC or Laptop.I'm wrong this is a fully working PC, with a score of 3.2 on windows index. Its not a powerhouse but for the size and the price this is AMAZING.Everything works perfect. Its a little slow but nothing insane. The screen is descent but not amazing but not horrible. I mean this is unbelievable for the price. Go get one.

Reviews.Title: Small and user friendly
Reviews.Author: Dan S. Druge
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a replacement for a netbook I use for ambulance use. I've had it one week and am loving it. I feel guilty because I use it more than my daily laptop which has served me faithfully for years. Learning windows 8 took a little playing with, but it's not too difficult to do.I would dig a full size USB port rather than the micro USB or both.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: SamSoCali
Reviews.Content: I love it so much! Its very easy to use. Super lightweight and compact. Only downside is the camera kinda sucks its only 2mp but if you mostly want it for school like me its perfect and I totally recommend it �

Reviews.Title: Best Tablet Option
Reviews.Author: RSVPAR
Reviews.Content: Has all the features of a desktop and very portable. Great buy! Wish they made a case that would hold the tablet & keyboard.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet PC for the price.
Reviews.Author: Darell McEllhenney
Reviews.Content: Excellent Windows 8 Tablet for the price. I have no complaints. I have read some negative remarks about the display. I am well pleased. I have no problems with the display.

Reviews.Title: Blank screens are frustrating
Reviews.Author: Jeanette K Adams
Reviews.Content: I like the size, touch screen, microsoft office, and a lot of its features. I can't stand that it randomly will not turn on. This is my second Acer tablet. The first one would not turn on and I sent it back. The replacement worked great for a month, but today is the second time it has not turned on when I pressed the power button. A few weeks ago it would not turn on. I called tech support and did all the things they told me to. It still would not turn on. As I was preparing it for shipping, I pushed the power button and it came on. I called tech support about this, and they told me to not send it to them for repair as they could not fix what it was not doing. I am waiting to see if it will turn on later today. (I am using my old laptop to send this review). It is very frustrating to not be able to turn on my computer/tablet. What use is a blank screen?

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: raerush1
Reviews.Content: I like it lots of things to do on it & very easy to use. It's small enough to fit in my bag.

Reviews.Title: very good tablet
Reviews.Author: Alqallaf
Reviews.Content: Very nice and good tabletU can take it any where and community all friendsI love this tabletNice

Reviews.Title: At $299 64gb is worth it.  Don't go smaller
Reviews.Author: V. Emanuel
Reviews.Content: I am a proud momma of an Asus 700.  My 11 year old sons Kindle fire died after a year and 4 months. and I replaced it with an Iconia.  I have had it for 3days.  I paid $299 for a 64 gig.  At this price, it is worth it. Do not go for a smaller hard drive version.I want to use it:1.  For homework (6th grade)2.  to play games (disappointed in the choices in store)3.  Watch my zune and amazon movies on.  I have thousands of dollars worth.DON'T BY KINDLE PRODUCTS THEY WON'T CHARGE AFTER A YEAR.Get the largest hard disc you can, because windows takes up a lot of space.  I was extremely disappointed that it took up about 30 GB in software.  This device operates like the full windows program.  So if you can install it, any program can work.This device does not have the beautiful screen, but do we need it.  Its resolution is good enough for watching videos on the go.  My Zune videos and Amazon Prime worked fine with this.I was happy that it runs nextissue.  The android version does not work in favor of google play storeThe Kindle app works fine.  However, the lack of space on the 64gb makes it hard to download all the books.It is irritating that I would have to pay again for all of my games.  Microsoft store does not have temple run, and seems to be missing angry birds.  Android has better apps and games.The sound quality is bad.  I probably have to find the settings to correct the tinny speakersIt does have a family monitor program that is better than google.My recommendation is get it for your kids.The virtual keyboard is useable, but not for typing letters.  The cheap Bluetooth keyboard works fineTo make windows devices as good as Androids, they need to come down in price, and make larger hard drives than 64GB.=====================================================================================================I am revising this after a month.  I really do not like this device.  The interface sucks.  Hard to swipe.  Microsoft need to scrap this and start over for windows devices.  The ease of use needs to be greatly improved for windows to compete with android.  If the choice is between this an android.  Choose the android.

Reviews.Title: Awsome little tablet
Reviews.Author: Dusty
Reviews.Content: The first one I ordered had a problem with the right side of the screen, but my replacement works Great, it does everything a P.C does except no disk drive obviously, very cool tablet

Reviews.Title: i like it
Reviews.Author: Jaylon Owens
Reviews.Content: I like my tablet. It is very useful. The screen is bright and colorful. The storage isn't all that great though...overall a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: tullymars101
Reviews.Content: I have read all the reviews hear and purchased the W3-810-1650 anyway.  I have had no screen issues or any other issues with the exception of my choice of an 8.1 inch tablet.  It is naturally harder to select an item on the screen due to the size and I expected and accept this limitation.  For me, being able to use MS Office on a small tablet is the reason I purchased the acer and Office works great.  If your looking for an 8 inch tablet this is the one to get.

Reviews.Title: Not bad, but not great
Reviews.Author: Taylor Corbet "Taylor Corbet"
Reviews.Content: Been playing with this for about a month now. Here's a list of my pros and cons:Pro*Size - I had mixed feelings about it (always felt iffy about the in-between tablets) but it's actually pretty nice and portable. My 10" ASUS is a bit too big to throw in my purse but this one works nicely if I want to play with it on a commute.OS - I'm an android/linux user all the way, but when it comes to this tablet, it's actually nice to have real Word and Excel, especially if I want to look at a file from work. I don't think it'll ever replace a computer, but again, for looking at something for work during my commute, making a small change, and sending it back in an email, it works.Cons*Screen - It's not bad... when looked at directly. Changing the angle even slightly really messes up the image.WiFi - When I hold it in landscape that the WiFi cuts in and out, and it's not just one magic spot or a port my finger closes, it happens all the time.Lack of regular USB port - The other ACER models I've seen had a regular USB port. In my mind, it justified their thickness. I feel like regular (not micro) USBs are still the most universal way we transfer files. It would have been a really nice feature here.Weight - It didn't feel as heavy as I thought, but it's almost the same weight as my ASUS 10", and considering it's only 8" but thicker, I would have preferred a lighter tablet.So all in all, not bad, but I think I'll stick with my laptop and ASUS Transformer Prime.

Reviews.Title: Full Windows 8 Experience on the go; Great value, especially if you can overcome the screen
Reviews.Author: Kiyo M.
Reviews.Content: One of the biggest complaints about this product is the screen. If you own an iPad or have been spoiled by retina/OLED displays, then you will be disappointed with the screen. Of course it is nowhere near as bright and sharp as those; however, I do also believe the complaints are definitely overblown and it's not horrible as everyone puts it out to be. There's some people who complained about the text being too fuzzy or not sharp; I've noticed when I received it, the resolution was low. Once Windows updated, having the resolution set to 1280x800, it looked much better. Yes, the screen viewing degree is not great, but it's not often you'll be using the tablet from the side. While it's no retina display, I do still get a sense of HD when playing HD videos.The touch keyboard is okay, but if you really want a full Windows 8-laptop/natural experience, then you'll definitely want an actual keyboard. I also purchased a Acer Bluetooth Keyboard (W3-810). Having a physical keyboard is much nicer, but it would have been nice if the tablet could actually be docked/locked into place and have it in different angles; it's basically just a simple bare stand, at a fixed angle, and if you move around a lot, it gets a bit annoying having to manually grab the tablet and keyboard together. It's nice to have shortcut functions on the keyboard, and it definitely gives the tablet a whole new life/better experience, just by combining with the keyboard. Being able to store the tablet on the back of the keyboard is a nice touch; however, it is made out of cheap plastic and the docking could have been thought out better.Having an actual mouse/cursor is also much nicer than using fingers on a full Windows. I wish the tablet had a regular full-size USB connection for connecting USB mouse dongles; however, the tablet only has a micro-USB port. I did purchase a micro-USB on-the-go cable and connected the Logitech Zone Touch Mouse T400 for Windows 8; it works and with the combination with the keyboard, it really turns the tablet into a real laptop experience.You really don't get much space left with this 32GB model with the Windows 8 OS and other installed things when you receive it. If you can, I would choose the model with more memory. However, I do appreciate they have a micro-SD card slot so you can have more memory.The left side (holding it in landscape position) of the tablet has the power button, micro USB slot and micro-HDMI port. the top side has the volume controls and micro-SD slot. The right side has the power connector and speakers.If you consider the size, the tablet is a bit on the heavy/bulky side.Pros:- Full Windows 8 Experience- Micro-SD slot for expanding more memory- Good battery lifeCons:- Screen (poor viewing angles/brightness; however, it's not as bad as most people make it out to be - Just don't expect iPad display)- Would be nice to have a full USB port.Now this definitely won't replace your computer. You can still definitely tell when browsing the web, it's not super speedy and loads more like it does on a tablet/smartphoneI definitely recommend attaching a keyboard/mouse with this tablet and you'll have a much nicer/real Windows 8 experience.

Reviews.Title: Great software but poor wifi hardware
Reviews.Author: Pikmin
Reviews.Content: I have this table for a month and I love it. The main reason is that Microsoft Office 2013 (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and OneNote) is included - Office 2013 itself can be worth $300. Note that when you run Office 2013 for the first time, the software will ask a serial number. Just enter the number on the back of the tablet. It works.Now let's talk about the bad feature - the wifi hardware. My other laptop, just an inch away from Acer Iconia W3, shows strong wifi signal (full bar), but Acer Iconia W3 can't get the signal. I have another occasion that Acer Iconia W3 is in the same room (about 8 feet away) from the wifi router, and it can't catch the wifi signal. After a restart, it can. The wifi feature is really really bad.Other reviewers complain about the "grainy" screen - especially with white background. I get used of it so no complaint.My last comment is about the internal storage. The 32GB one is not enough. Think about long term use and get the 64GB.

Reviews.Title: Terrible tablet
Reviews.Author: Evan Heward
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to begin with cons. The plastic in front feels cheap. At $400, it's overpriced. Still comes shipped with Windows 8 even though 8.1 is out. My biggest problem is the screen. It may be capacitive, but it can be unresponsive and unwieldy. The screen has a high resolution but still looks grainy and poor quality. Just an overall hunk of crap. Don't buy it. I recommend the Dell Venue 8 Pro, which has a nice display, feels sturdy and has a responsive 10 point touch screen, all for $300. No, Dell is not paying me, It's just I bought two tablets to compare and the Acer is going back.

Reviews.Title: Have the right expectation for the screen. Cool otherwise.
Reviews.Author: Z28James
Reviews.Content: Lets start this all off with a few words about the screen. The screen is a lower quality TFT display that favors viewing angles from head on and to the right. I assume this is to assure being able to view the screen adequately from portrait and landscape. When looking at the screen you see what could only be described as if there was a matte screen protector on top of it. I got used to it but I also have a matte screen protector on my HTC One X that has the same effect. Don't discount what people have said about the screen. Have the proper expectations and you will be fine. If this thing cost me $600 I'd be pissed for sure.With that being said here are my thoughts on the pros of this tablet.The first is that it runs full on windows 8 and you can actually take advantage of the pieces meant for a touch screen. You can run full on x86 32bit programs as you do on your desktop.Second, it is versatile. I was sitting on the couch working on some documents when it dawned on me. Why try and forcefully do work on this tablet using a touch screen when I could be doing this much more comfortably with a mouse/keyboard. Seeing that this tablet has HDMI out + USB OTG I simply plugged in a mouse/keyboard/monitor and I was using the tablet like a full on PC. After I was done I unplugged the tablet and took the tablet to work where I utilized the finished documents. I plan on keeping a Micro HDMI cable at work so I can simply plug this at my desk into PC peripherals.Third, the battery life is decent. 8-9 hours is completely obtainable.Fourth, the form factor is just right. 8.1 inches is big enough to provide a comfortable experience. I always know that when I want more that I just plug it into a monitor.Fifth is performance. The UI is fluid. Metro UI apps tend to be the most fluid but "desktop" apps are very acceptable. For a $279 device this thing delivers. I even installed steam and you would be surprised how many games actually run. It handles emulators no problem. Video decoding is no problem.I love this thing. I have a beastly desktop PC rig, a hardcore gaming laptop, a linux work laptop and an iPad 4. Somehow this thing still manages to fit right in.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Impressed!
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: I tested one out for an hour or so in the store. I was surprised by how much I liked it. I will hold off buying one, for now, until the price drops since I already have another Win 8 tablet.The screen was a little lower quality than most tablets on the market. However, after a few minutes of playing with it I did get used to it and didn't even notice. I would imagine that after using it day-in and day-out, it would become a non-issue.The machine was quicker than I thought it would be. The metro interface and apps worked flawlessly and smoothly. Absolutely loved it! The Windows desktop worked acceptably well, but I only tried a few programs out. Overall, the desktop and programs felt way faster than my older atom netbook, so I would call it quite functional (especially for an on-the-go desktop experience).But, really, what are you expecting from an 8" pocket computer: supercomputing ability? No! It's a tablet, you'll be using it as such and it will perform wonderfully in that task. The desktop is just a bonus, and a pretty good one, at that!I gave it 4 starts because it works as it should and for a great price. But, the screen isn't perfect and neither are its features (Seriously? No GPS?) so its score isn't perfect.

Reviews.Title: dont be fooled by the price
Reviews.Author: Jorge S.
Reviews.Content: don't let the price fool you. this table kicks major butt.  it updated to windows 8.1 very smoothly. runs as fast as my wifes expensive tablet

Reviews.Title: not worth
Reviews.Author: giorgi
Reviews.Content: low quality screen, overheats very often, battery life is good, is slow, little heavy, low quality cameras, overall quality is low too, left speaker stop working in 3 days, charges fast, this is a tablet which you should avoid.

Reviews.Title: dont do it
Reviews.Author: bsracing
Reviews.Content: Had a while and only after many frustrating days I have to get the word out. Design was absolutely thought less you have to power button 2 or3 second s to turn on. But brush the power button and down it goes. 1st one had a bad battery keyboard has to be persuaded to work.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Screen!
Reviews.Author: AJ808
Reviews.Content: While the size and speed were good, it has a horrible display.  The text appears blurry, like a cheap screen protector was still attached, but there wasn't one, I had already removed it!  I ended up getting the ASUS Transformer Book T100.  Much better!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Roger D. Stepp
Reviews.Content: Works great no where near as many glitches as an android,occasionally likes to sleep in when you wake it up,just put back to sleep and awaken it again. The only real issue I have run into are Windows based automatic updates,they can occur at the most inopportune times and can be quite a burden on your data package if you tether it to a cell phone (can be 2-3 GB at a time or as many updates as Microsoft thinks you have to have that day of course). So make sure you turn off automatic updates immediately if you travel and tether your tablet to a cell. And don't think if you turn it off at night it won't do the updates till you want it to. Oh yes,Much like any Windows based auto update system, It adapts, It overcomes,and it will update whether you like it or not, midway into your day (in background of course) when you have no idea that it's happening and when you really need the use of your computer,Like right now,and not in 6 to 30 minutes while watching the ----Preparing Updates 1 of 16. Do Not Turn Off Your Computer During This Process message. Turn those off and you will love this tablet.

Reviews.Title: nice tablet, but poor dealer
Reviews.Author: Martin Solomon
Reviews.Content: the dealer's ad said that there was a 14-day return policy.  What the ad did not say was that there was a 10% restocking fee.  That was, in my mind, deceptive advertising.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size
Reviews.Author: Bill Wimer
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what i was looking for as a gift. The person who got the tablet loves it. No Office 2013 included!

Reviews.Title: Purchased for a company promo.
Reviews.Author: Randy Fulk
Reviews.Content: Nice tablet, purchased about a dozen or so and had to return 3 for bad power supply problem.  Thank you

Reviews.Title: Excelent mini pc
Reviews.Author: Waldo
Reviews.Content: Don't pay too much attention to the viewing angles. You can see from where you sit perfectly. It's a great little machine, for the price! I needed it for powerpoint presentations and the fact that has an individual port for charging it leaves both ports micro usb and hdmi open for all the extra tasks. I first bought the toshiba encore, but it overheats to the point you can't hold it in your hand and having to charge through the micro usb didn't allow me to connect the dongle for the powerpoint slide changer. Couldn't be happier. The refurbisher even included the keyboard (which other sellers don't) and a sleeve cover.Ok, only one item does bug me a little: the weight, for even though it's small enough to hold, it's too heavy to do work while holding it. But since I'll be using it with the keyboard only, I don't mind it that much. If you need to hold in your hands then look somewhere else, this is the heaviest of the windows 8 tablets

Reviews.Title: Not as responsive as some
Reviews.Author: debrasue
Reviews.Content: this tablet just isn't as responsive as say the Microsoft Surface or some others. Aside from that I do like being able to carry my win8 system to work as a mobile office

Reviews.Title: problems
Reviews.Author: john bergin
Reviews.Content: I have only owned this product a short time but wouldn't recommend it as it started giving me problems. It freezes while using it, and then doesn't start. It offers an option for troubleshooting, but when u go to select this option it again freezes up.

Reviews.Title: Screen broke the first day... Not strong
Reviews.Author: Jeffery S Edwards
Reviews.Content: This was a nice Windows 8 pro tablet for my son once I installed Stardoc's Start8 on it. My son had it on his desk and knocked it off. It was in a case and had a screen protector. But no luck.... The LCD/LED screen cracked behind the glass. Big tare in the display. I was lucky to get the Squatetrade warranty. They refunded my money in about 30 -45 days. No one had a replacement lcd. I looked myself and only found one in China.... It was 1 1/2 timed the unit itself. No he has an Android tablet for school for $130 at Walmart. That was the way to go.I did read that Acer has now replaced this model from it's line after a few months.

Reviews.Title: nice product but not enough hard drive space
Reviews.Author: DP
Reviews.Content: great product but returned it because the 32 gb version was just too small. after updates i had about 8 gb left to play with and had a hard time making the sd card default for anything.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: Swimmer4Life
Reviews.Content: When you get a tablet that has full windows you hope to use it like a full computer. That would be the case if it had a full USB.

Reviews.Title: No Microsoft Office!!!
Reviews.Author: Mesix
Reviews.Content: FALSE ADVERTISING!  this tablet DOES NOT come with Microsoft Office.  When I clicked on the Office icon, I was prompted to buy MS Office or to activate a free trial of Office 360.  Microsoft Office Home & Student was not installed as the product information and the packaging claim.  I contacted Acer and was told that only the trial version is included.  The product information should be updated to say that this tablet does not have any productivity software which is not included with Windows 8.I gave 2 stars (instead of 1) because after paying for MS Office separately, the hardware does a good job of running it.  It works especially nice with the bluetooth keyboard (ordered separately).

Reviews.Title: There are better options.
Reviews.Author: Frank Hunt
Reviews.Content: The concept of having a full fledged OS on a tablet was a game changer.  It became a great companion for my phone.  Once tethered to my cell phone, I was able to go over Excel docs while on the phone with co-workers.  I VPN'ed in to my network and ran simple SQL scripts while commuting on the train.  I even sent a fax while on the train.  I even had my Avaya Softphone software installed on it.  Plus this thing can fit in my pocket!Stuff like this is what made me secretly laugh at those other iPad or Andriod tablet users that I saw.  My tablet had built in flash and you didn't automatically get the mobile version when you get to a particular site (I experience this all the time on my Samsung 10.1 tablet).So why I am only giving it 2 stars?- Well, I was never happy with the screen.  It never bothered me in public or on the train.  However I ended up getting headaches when trying to use it as an e-reader at home.- The screen isn't very responsive.- The tablet bricked on me two months after I purchased it.  I never dropped it so damage can't be attributed for this.Going back to the screen and overall quality of this tablet... There are now a lot of options for 8 inch tablets with a full fledged OS on it.  With that said, I am still going to make Acer replace this tablet.However I am already looking for something with a better build quality such as the Lenovo Miix 2.  It truly frustrates me that companies like Acer and HP still put out junk.  Most PC businesses are suffering from declining device sales.  They blame it on a shift in consumer demands.  However it's possible that they are losing sales to companies like Apple and Lenovo (yes, Lenovo's business is doing great), because they put out sub standard products like this.

Reviews.Title: Meh, but what do you expect for $380?
Reviews.Author: J. Heffner
Reviews.Content: I've spent a ton of time with Windows 8 tablets. I love the Acer W700, I appreciate the Dell Latitude 10. And then, there is this guy.I like the tablet or phablet, in this case. However, the screen is flat out ugly. As mentioned in another review, I don't know why they chose green for the default color scheme, because it makes the text look like a glob of pixels. It is nasty to the eye.But, if you are looking for an 8" tablet with Windows 8 pro, and under the $400 mark, then this is your choice. Hopefully they upgrade the panel quality in the future, but it is usable.

Reviews.Title: Usable
Reviews.Author: Karl
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant on to getting this, but for an on the go portable device that can install many traditional programs, this is a good device.  Surely as everyone has stated, the screen isn't much to brag about.  In my opinion, its fine, definitely not the best..the viewing angles are not great, but its not unbearable either.  I like reading comics and manga on my commute to work and this thing is great to use.Watching a movie is great and not great.  Using X-Box Video, the volume is realllllly low.  I have an air conditioning unit that can make some noise, so with that on, I can barely hear the movie at all.  Now, the funny thing is..I open the browser, go to youtube, and the volume is amazingly loud, so I can only blame Microsoft and not Acer.  Using Netflix, volume is good too.I'm not sure if there is a setting on this that can adjust it as I only just got this, but thats that.So yes, not the #1 tablet in the world, but those fans of Windows 8, and like 8 inch tablets this is a good investment in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: if you want better, pay the price
Reviews.Author: SK "wurdnurd"
Reviews.Content: So I just needed something portable so I can get my online lectures after my laptop crapped out. the price was right, comes loaded with Windows and Office, and is the right size. Honestly, I know the other reviews are complaining about resolution, viewability, speakers and whatever...if you're going to pay less than $380 for a fully-loaded Windows tablet, please manage your expectations! My only two complaints are that the loudest setting on the speaker isn't terribly loud (I typically use headphones anyway) and closing tabs in Chrome is a little bit of a pain (though I'm going to try a stylus to see if that helps. Otherwise, the absolute most frustrating thing is the lack of case styles...it seems that 10.1" Windows tablets are MUCH more popular. Still, if you just need something basic to use for email, docs and videos, it's a very reasonably-priced option.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy this
Reviews.Author: Dirk D.
Reviews.Content: The screen display on this is absolutely horrible....I mean ABSOLUTELY. I couldn't play with this more than 5 minutes before deciding to return it. I'm a Windows guy and can't wait for someone to come out with a decent tablet

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Thomas "Style-in"
Reviews.Content: Hate it.....touch is not sensitive enough. If the web page has a drop down tab that does not allow a scroll...forget trying to get where you want to go. You'll need ear buds to hear anything. Trying to get the keyboard to slide up when trying to type in a web address can be hit or miss. Just terrible.

Reviews.Title: Nice looking hardware but doesn't turn on.
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: I think the hardware feels pretty nice but unfortunately the tablet won't turn on.  I was hoping the screen wasn't as bad as everyone says but I guess I'll never know.  I am returning this and I certainly wouldn't buy the updated version of this tablet that is supposed to come out soon.  Don't buy this tablet.  Wait till the Lenovo Miix 8 or the Dell Venue 8 come out.  Your going to want an IPS display not whatever this display is.  I find it funny how they tried to price this originally like an iPad, its laughable to think that people would buy this over an iPad considering the screen is taken from Fisher Price.  Shame on you Acer.

Reviews.Title: Good inside, bad presentation
Reviews.Author: PAVEL SHEVCHOUK
Reviews.Content: Very poor quality of the screen, it spoils overall impression of this not bad device. Can't use it keeping my eyes.

Reviews.Title: Excellent portable full computer tablet, it gets my work done
Reviews.Author: SL
Reviews.Content: Found this video on YouTube w3 in action. No need write my opinion. Just watching video shows how fast and fluid and full computer that can get your work done. Goto and watch videos. Makes iPad toy and laggy android fail.YouTube.com/thewebmogul

Reviews.Title: The screen is probably a deal breaker for most buyers.
Reviews.Author: Paul Katz
Reviews.Content: So, I don't own one of these, but I got a very thorough hands-on demo at Staples. It's a real shame about the screen. It's dim, and the viewing angles aren't good at all. I tried the W3 in portrait mode, and unless you look at it absolutely dead on, the color reproduction on the bottom looks different than the color reproduction on the top. And frankly, the screen also looks kind of grainy.Some reviews make light of the screen issue; my recommendation, go to Office Depot or Staples to get a demo of the W3 before buying. The screen is quite a compromise to live with every time you use the W3, and you should know what you are getting into.Does it come with a free copy of Microsoft Office? Yes, but quite frankly you'd be better off spending less money on a larger Lenovo tablet with an IPS display, and then buy Microsoft Office later.Why am I giving the W3 two stars instead of one? Besides the screen, it seems like a fairly solid Atom-based machine. Things seemed to run fairly snappy. But really, it's telling the tablet is only available at Staples and Office Depot from a retail standpoint and that there was so much emphasis on preorders. This is hardware aimed at buyers that don't know any better.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the kids!
Reviews.Author: Josh B
Reviews.Content: easy for them to use and small for there hands to carry around.  It does run on a atom chip, but I expected that.  Battery life hasn't been too bad for it's price point.  I am a windows fan, so keep bringing those small tablets.  good start for Microsoft!

Reviews.Title: Great form factor but a bad implementation
Reviews.Author: Gadget Dude "revlisoft"
Reviews.Content: I gotten this as a gift.  Even with this being free I couldn't bring myself to like it.  The screen is just horrible and the windows desktop is excruciatingly painful to work with.  It took me 20+ taps to close a browser tab.  Everything looks so grainy and so hard to read under *any* light.  Why did Acer make their product so bad by pairing it with probably the worst TN screens available.  They shouldn't even make screens like this in the year 2013!With that being said the only thing that had going for it was the form-factor which makes me want to get an iPad mini once they include a retina display on it.  Take the $429 and use it towards an iPad Mini and you'll be much happier!

Reviews.Title: Will not even power on
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The device will not power on. The power charging light flashes intermittently.  I called Acer.  They said it is a faulty unit.  Apparently they do not even check the unit because it has no charge at all.  He said it should boot up without charging it at least once.  I would recommend finding another company to do business with.  This left me in a bad spot since I am traveling and now have to lug 2 laptops with me.

Reviews.Title: Piece of rubbish
Reviews.Author: Just Bethy "Trekkie"
Reviews.Content: I would have let the kids have it .. but it was such rubbish I wouldn't wish it on them. Can't get into it!! Key board, if it shows up, freezes all the time and pops up all kinds of effed up characters when you press anything...can't fix it .. its just a waste of time. I am not computer savvy.. I shouldn't have needed to be with something like this ..

Reviews.Title: Acer W3 is great for what it is
Reviews.Author: goconfigure
Reviews.Content: It's actually a bargain. Considering that a copy of Windows 8 goes for $100 or more/lessAND it includes Office (that's at least $120) this thing is pretty cool. Truth be told the display isn't the absolute worst and its quite viewable indoors. Outdoors is another story though. It runs Photoshop and Dreamweaver very well and movies are watchable. Yes, the display could be better but it would raise the price point. Buy this for the versatility of Win8 and included Office. I suggest getting the keyboard too because it is very useful. I use mine hooked up to my NAS for storage and XBMC runs great while the tablet is connected to the TV. Use the Bluetooth keyboard to control XBMC from the sofa. Pretty neat. I take it out to the car and use it as a dash cam and music client using audio over Bluetooth. Bottom line, it works for me but it may not work for you. Try it out and see if you can live with the display and if that's not a deal breaker then buy it.UPDATEInstall Win 8.1 on this and enjoy a new experience on this machine! It is impressive to say the least. 9 hour battery life!!! Are you kidding me!?Windows multitasking on this machine is stellar. Being able to update my website via Flash and Dreamweaver is priceless to me. I even made a security camera program using Visual Basic! Its power and utility will surprise you. The display is the only flaw I can find with this and even still its not awful. I can't wait for the next crop of win 8 8 to 7 inch devices!

Reviews.Title: Great x 2 days then black screen of death
Reviews.Author: KSJ "KSJ"
Reviews.Content: I loved the idea of Windows 8 in tablet size near size of my Kindle and for 2 days I REALLY liked this device.  I'm not as sensitive to screen issues as some reviewers are so didn't notice problems they did.  Not sure if there was a manufacturing defect but out of the box, it didn't fully charge even plugged in overnight.  I was starting to personalize Windows 8 for me when it died after taking a picture.  I couldn't get it to turn on or flicker.  Even looked for a place to stick in a paperclip (I'm old-fashioned) to restart it.  I didn't know about "black screen of death" on tablets till searching online.  I've owned several small Acer products (Acer One etc) and have been VERY happy with their reliability so this may be a fluke, but after going online to find out what I could do to resurrect my tablet I read reviews about the $75 keyboard and black screen of death on other tablets and other issues...so, when I took my Acer Iconia back to the store today, I left with an HP Envy (twice the cost, hopefully twice the reliability).  I haven't opened that box yet.  If the Iconia W3 had kept working as well as it did first 2 days, I could have given it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Really bad screen
Reviews.Author: DanielNTX "Daniel"
Reviews.Content: So I bought this from the Microsoft Store and returned it within two days.  The screen is just really bad.  They should have used an IPS panel instead of a TN panel.  This results in very poor viewing angles unless viewed directly in front of the screen.  Also the screen is semi hazy where other reviews stated it look like it had a screen protector on but it doesn't.  The weight of the device is also heavier than expected.  The device itself is a good idea, but it's execution is a failure.

Reviews.Title: one day uncle Jeb and I were hunting for some food and up came bubbling crude
Reviews.Author: pen name
Reviews.Content: That thing is harder to operate than teaching a Cat algebra. And it's slower than grandma and she was slow. Real slow.So I sent er back. Got my money back and bought me some lotto tickets. I'm a gazllionair now.  And I bought that there computer company and turned it into a commune for hippies.Man the world is a funny place.All hail Amazon From whom All internet blessings flow. AMAZON

Reviews.Title: This was an awful experience.
Reviews.Author: Mike Walters
Reviews.Content: I was so disappointed with the W3. It was sluggish and unresponsive on so many programs. I think this is a product of Windows 8 on the tablet more than the hardware itself. I read a lot and opening books in the 3m reader app or kindle was atrocious. I returned the unit after 2 days. Liked the weight and feel of the product but unresponsive software made it a no go. Screen visibility was an issue as well with poor resolution and brightness.

Reviews.Title: Don't bother...New model available Sept. 2013..Save your money!!
Reviews.Author: TEVA NOVA
Reviews.Content: UPDATES 7/28/13ACER has admitted they screw up on this one and will offer a better model with IPS display this September 2013 due to poor sales and complain from their retailers.I have been using the Acer Iconia 10" model for the gym for close to a year and very happy with it.  I was hoping this new 8" version would have the same built quality...WRONG O!!.  The problem with Acer product is that it's a hit or miss and boy did Acer mess up on this one.  Fisher Price built quality and a horrible, horrible, horrible screen by today's standard. If Google can built a nice screen for a $199 tablet, why can't Acer.  They really blew it. It's going to be in the clearance aisle before you know it.  This tablet reminds me those cheap knock off tablet pre-android days. We need more 8" Win8 Pro tablet but Acer cuts corner in all the wrong places.  Save your money for better future 8" offerings.

Reviews.Title: Tried this at the store
Reviews.Author: J. Lieder
Reviews.Content: This device is terrible.  Barely readable, lousy color, and could not pull down submenus with a finger (meaning touch is horrendous on this thing).Please someone - anyone - improve upon this with a better product...this one is a joke.  Its actually worse than the overpriced hot brick called MS Surface Pro.Can't anyone get an inexpensive powerful Windows Tablet for the masses right?  Acer Iconia W700 looked close but its got problems too (see all the reviews here in Amazon and hone in on the lower numbered ones).  Quality control developers and hardware producers....you can do it!

Reviews.Title: OMG, how did this get to market?
Reviews.Author: Morley Dotes "morleydotes"
Reviews.Content: To save you time, get yourself an iPad mini and be happy. If you need some entertainment, or enjoy watching someone suffer, keep reading.This tablet would be good if it were priced 90% off! Otherwise, FORGET IT!!! First, you don't get 32 gb. You get under 11 gigs! ....ok, let's start from the outside. The power button on the edge makes me nuts. I constantly am turning it off by accident. And with the lack of connectivity while in landscape position, you would think I'd learn my lesson, but I like lanscape and you shouldn't have to suffer for it. Also, the second it takes to rotate the screen (currently it is stuck onportrait mode for some reason), is annoying. Just when you think it's going to take long, it changes. The tablet is also slippery, so becareful not to drop it....or not. This really is like a practical joke. It is unresponsive, sometimes having to press an icon multiple times before anything happens. I'm kind of like the guy who gets a paper that saysturn over for something special and then you turn it over and it says turn over for something special. I am the idiot who keeps turning it over expecting a different result. I suspect the camera is filming this somewhere and people are getting a mighty good laugh out of it. "Look, he's trying it again! What a moron. You are absolutley brilliant Mr. Pavlov."The charging hole and the earphone hole are on the bottom edge and we often confuse the two, very annoying. The tablet gets hot, while using and while charging, very annoying. You need to sign in to Acer cloud to use some stuff, download updates, nowI have8 gigs free....annoying....are you seeinga pattern evolving?I love sitting 15 feet from my wireless router, with no walls, and constantly dropping connections. Have I mentioned that I am getting annoyed?This is NOT an intuitive OS or tablet....not in the slightest. I guess if you are used to Windows 8 (my condolences) you won't hate it as much.I have to say that the viewing angle is not all that bad in a well lit room. I'm surprised, however, that they did not market it as a "privacy" screen, as the idiot writing this review would have probably bought right in. Btw, rotation is back.FYI, this comes with kindle, acer explorer, huluplus, 7digital, evernote, chacha, zinio, ebay, didlr, stumblupon, netflix, icookbook, skype, tunein, newsexpresso, socialjogger, acer crystal eye, spotify, etc.Ok, here is a comparison, the iPad mini is better in every way. The viewing screen is better and just about the same size. The mini is faster, connects better, is more intuitive and you don't have to buy 32 gig to get 8 gigs! Battery life is pretty much the same. I know, the ipad cannot accept an Sd card...oh wait, neither can the Acer. You can use a micro SD, and since you will probably need it, I'd get a 64 gig card....if you still insist on getting this....and if that's the case, I believe amazon sells whips and chains as well, this way you can beat beat yourself for not listening. I have done my best to talk you out of this....but if not, go to the apple store first and try out a mini.
